intro: Hieracium virgicaule var. subtatrae, commonly known as the Subtatra hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its rosette-forming basal leaves and yellow-orange composite flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. It is a low-growing species with slender stems and is often found in rocky or grassy meadows. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic plant in certain regions.
